'''Balcmeg''' was an [[Orcs|Orc]] slain by [[Tuor]] in [[Gondolin]].<ref>{{LT2|Index}}, entry "Balcmeg"</ref>

== History ==
Balcmeg was considered to be ''"a great fighter among the [[Orclim]]"''.<ref name="Appendix">{{LT2|Appendix}}, entry "Balcmeg"</ref>

During the [[Fall of Gondolin]], Balcmeg was among those Orcs which assailed the [[Gondothlim]] alongside the [[Balrogs]] at the coming of the [[Dragons|Drakes]]. Balcmeg was ultimately slain by Tuor, who hewed him asunder with his axe, [[Dramborleg]], in the process.<ref name="LT2Gondolin">{{LT2|III}}, p. 181</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Balcmeg'' is a [[Gnomish]] name meaning "heart of evil",<ref>{{PE|15}}, p. 21</ref> being comprised of the element ''[[Balc]]'' ("evil, cruel").<ref name="Appendix"/> Its [[Qenya]] form was ''Malkamekte''.<ref>{{PE|13}}, p. 105</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
Balcmeg never appeared within any of Tolkien's writing after "[[The Fall of Gondolin (chapter)|The Fall of Gondolin]]" in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.
